1.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

2.text: Command the children of Israel, that they bring unto thee the finest and dearest oil of olives, to furnish the lamps continually,

3.text: Without the veil of the testimony in the tabernacle of the covenant. And Aaron shall set them from evening until morning before the Lord, by a perpetual service and rite in your generations.

4.text: They shall be set upon the most pure candlestick before the Lord continually.

5.text: Thou shalt take also fine hour, and shalt bake twelve leaves thereof, two tenths shall be in every loaf :

6.text: And thou shalt set them six and six one against another upon the most clean table before the Lord:

7.text: And thou shalt put upon them the dearest frankincense, that the bread may be for a memorial of the oblation of the Lord.

8.text: Every sabbath they shall be changed before the Lord, being received of the children of Israel by an everlasting covenant:

9.text: And they shall be Aaron’s and his sons’, that they may eat them in the holy place: because it is most holy of the sacrifices of the Lord by a perpetual right.

10.text: And behold there went out the son of a woman of Israel, whom she had of an Egyptian, among the children of Israel, and fell at words in the camp with a man of Israel.

11.text: And when he had blasphemed the name, and had cursed it, he was brought to Moses: (now his mother was called Salumith, the daughter of Dabri, of the tribe of Dan:)

12.text: And they put him into prison, till they might know what the Lord would command.

13.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses,

14.text: Saying: Bring forth the blasphemer without the camp, and let them that heard him, put their hands upon his head, and let all the people stone him.

15.text: And thou shalt speak to the children of Israel: the man that curseth his God, shall bear his sin:

16.text: And he that blasphemeth the name of the Lord, dying let him die: all the multitude shall stone him, whether he be a native or a stranger. He that blasphemeth the name of the Lord, dying let him die.

17.text: He that striketh and killeth a man, dying let him die.

18.text: He that killeth a beast, shall make it good, that is to say, shall give beast for beast.

19.text: He that giveth a blemish to any of his neighbours: as he hath done, so shall it be done to him:

20.text: Breach for breach, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, shall he restore. What blemish he gave, the like shall he be compelled to suffer.

21.text: He that striketh a beast, shall render another. He that striketh a man shall be punished.

22.text: Let there be equal judgment among you, whether he be a stranger, or a native that offends: because I am the Lord your God.

23.text: And Moses spoke to the children of Israel: and they brought forth him that had blasphemed, without the camp, and they stoned him. And the children of Israel did as the Lord had commanded Moses.
